items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels have risen on the River Cole and Dorcan Brook as a result of heavy rainfall overnight. Therefore, flooding of low-lying land, footpaths and roads is expected later this morning 20/10/21, especially in the Lower Stratton area. 
Further heavier rainfall is forecast this morning, with additional light showers possible through the rest of today. We expect river levels to begin rising imminently.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff will be in the area clearing trash screens. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated this evening, 20/10/21, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels have risen on the River Wey as a result of heavy rainfall overnight. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland is expected this morning 20/10/21, especially in the Passfield area. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point. Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. We expect river levels to remain high for the next few days. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff have been in the area clearing trash screens. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated this evening, 20/10/21, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Asker, River Brit, River Bride, River Char, River Lim

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise and will affect locations near to the River Lim, River Char, River Winniford, Simene River, River Brit, River Asker, River Mangerton, River Bride due to heavy rainfall .
River levels will be at their highest between 09:00 PM on the 19/10/21 and 01:00 AM on 20/10/2021.
Heavy rainfall is forecast overnight which will cause river levels to rise.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and update this alert if necessary.
Consider activating any property flood protection products if available.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 20/10/2021, or as the situation changes.

Some unexpected intense rain this evening means that flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Upper Dorset Frome, Hooke River, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Toller Whelme and Dorchester.
River levels will be at their highest between 09:30 PM on the 19/10/21 until 3:00AM on the 20/10/21.
Further rainfall is forecast overnight causing river levels to rise rapidly.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and update this alert if necessary.
Consider activating any property flood protection products in Maiden Newton if available.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 11:00 AM on 20/10/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
Heavy rainfall has triggered local rainfall alarms. The Environment Agency believes that based
on the intensity and amount of rainfall, properties are at immediate risk of flooding along Priory
Road, Swans Ghyll, Riverside and Blenheim Fields. If you have them, activate your property
protection measures now. Flooding is expected imminently.

items.description: South Devon coast from Start Point to Dawlish Warren
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tides on Tuesday and Wednesday evening. High water on Tuesday at Teignmouth is at 19:00, times of high water will vary along the coast.
The forecast wind and wave conditions will result in rough seas at Torbay. Spray overtopping will result in minor flooding at Torbay, Dawlish, and Teignmouth. Expect tides to be up to 440mm higher than predicted due to weather conditions.
People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast.
Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required.
Detailed tidal information for those who use it; The forecast high tide level at Teignmouth on Tuesday at 19:00 is 2.38 mAOD, this is 0.25 metres above astronomical tide level. On Wednesday high tide will be at 19:45 with predicted levels of 2.59mAOD, 0.44m above astronomic tide level.

Wednesday afternoon's tide at 12:15 on 20/10/2021 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with strong South Westerly Force 7 winds and large waves. The weather increases tide table values by 0.18 m. The total forecast tide is 6.03 metres Chart Datum (2.98 mAOD) at Littlehampton. For 2 hours either side of high tide wave overtopping will affect the beach front. A very small amount of water may collect on nearby land, fields and at Climping Street Car Park. Tide conditions are forecast to be similar until Friday 22/10/2021, with Wednesday evening's tide likely to be slightly (20cm) higher than Wednesday afternoon's. We continue to monitor the forecast. We may check the condition of the beach at low tide. Shingle and debris can be thrown by large waves. Access could be restricted during and after high tide. Take care if visiting Climping beach. We will update this message by 14:00 on 20/10/2021

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Hayle, Perrancoombe Stream, Bolingey Stream, River Cober, Portreath Stream

items.message:
This flood alert has been triggered by the Portreath Stream river level gauge. 

Following heavy rain during Tuesday evening river levels upstream on the Portreath Stream and other small watercourses have risen rapidly, resulting in surface water flooding and localised flooding of low lying ground and minor roads. 

Further heavy showers are expected over night, and with a further band of rain during Wednesday, river levels may increase further on Wednesday night. 

This alert will be updated by 11am on Wed 20 Oct.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Avon, River Erme, River Harbourne

items.message:
Flooding is possible on Tuesday night and into the early hours of Wednesday morning.

Over the last 24 hours we have seen heavy rainfall in the South Devon area. We are expecting the rainfall to clear by midnight on Tuesday. This has meant that the rivers in the South Devon area are continuing to rise. 

We expect the rivers to remain high throughout Tuesday night and into Wednesday morning. Flooding to low lying land and roads close to the rivers is expected.
Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. 

We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location. This message will be updated on Wednesday afternoon or earlier if the situation changes.

Due to some unexpected intense rainfall earlier in the evening river levels have risen quickly at the Maiden Newton river gauge. Consequently we are expecting possible flooding of property.  
There is further rainfall due for the next few hours, some of which could be heavy.  
We are closely monitoring the situation.   
Please can owners with property flood resilience equipment install it now and stay aware in case further warnings are issued.  
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 20/10/21, or as the situation changes

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Plym, Tory Brook, Long Brook

items.message:
Following heavy rain during Tuesday evening river levels at Carnwood on the River Plym have risen rapidly. We expect rivers in the area to remain high throughout Tuesday night and into Wednesday morning. Flooding to low lying land and roads close to the rivers is expected.Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. 

Further heavy showers are expected over night, and with a further band of rain during Wednesday, river levels may increase further. We are monitoring river levels overnight and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location. This message will be updated by 11am on Wed 20 Oct or earlier if the situation changes.

items.description: River Avon from Didworthy to Aveton Gifford
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is expected on Tuesday night and the early hours of Wednesday morning.

Over the last 24 hours we have seen heavy rainfall in the South Devon area, which we are expecting to clear by midnight on Tuesday. This is causing the River Avon to rise and the river is forecast to continue rising throughout Tuesday night and into the early hours of Wednesday morning.

Properties and low lying areas in South Brent, Avonwick, Brushford and Manor House near Diptford, Gara Bridge, Loddiswell and Aveton Gifford will start to flood first.

Flood waters may be deep and fast flowing in these areas. Residents are strongly urged to take action now. Remain safe and be aware of your local surroundings.

We will be closely monitoring river levels throughout Tuesday night. This message will be updated on Wednesday morning, or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Following heavy rain during Tuesday evening river levels on the River Yealm have risen rapidly, We expect the rivers to remain high throughout Tuesday night and into Wednesday morning. Flooding to low lying land and roads close to the rivers is expected.
Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. 

Further heavy showers are expected over night, and with a further band of rain during Wednesday, river levels may increase further. We are monitoring river levels overnight and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location. This message will be updated by 11am on Wed 20 Oct or earlier if the situation changes.

items.description: River Avon at South Brent, Avonwick and Aveton Gifford
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is expected on Tuesday night and the early hours of Wednesday morning.

Over the last 24 hours we have seen heavy rainfall in the South Devon area, which we are expecting to clear by midnight on Tuesday. This is causing the River Avon to rise and the river is forecast to continue rising throughout Tuesday night and into the early hours of Wednesday morning.

Properties and low lying areas in South Brent, Avonwick and Aveton Gifford will start to flood first.

Flood waters may be deep and fast flowing in these areas. Residents are strongly urged to take action now. Remain safe and be aware of your local surroundings.
